Sakura Kinomoto awoke from her slumber; it took her a while to remember what day it was in her half-asleep state but when she did she brightened up. Today was her birthday! She leapt out of bed and got herself together.

Something wasn't quite right. There was no call for breakfast from her father or her brother, no sound of them moving about. For now she just thought they had something special planned, but she didn't realise just how special it was.

Upon going downstairs and into the kitchen she habitually said. "Morn..." She was stunned to see nobody there but her breakfast had already been served and steam was still coming off. She sat down to start, wondering what was going on, as she ate she looked down to see a formation on the tabletop spelling 'Happy Birthday' in her native Japanese. She found a sweet thought until she took a closer look. This was certainly a surprise and a shock. There was a whole team of maids one-fiftieth normal size on the tabletop!

"Happy Birthday, Empress Sakura!" They cried out.
11312.title: A Very Special Birthday

"Anywhere you like, Sakura-san." Fujitaka answered. "But their seat is in the capital city. You'll find a pack containing everything you need to know in the living room." With this Sakura stood up to her new height of two hundred and eight foot, four and gave a slight bow saying.

She reached for the plate.

"If you please, great Empress." One of the maids announced. "Allow us to attend to the dishes." Sakura looked at them and at her empty breakfast plate.

"But how can you manage dishes this big?" She asked with concern. The tiny maids seemed to beam at this.

"We got your breakfast out all right, Empress, so we can handle washing up afterwards." The maid answered.

"I don't wish to offend you, m'lady." Another spoke. "But it wouldn't seem proper for our great leader to burden herself with menial chores." Sakura felt embarrassed by this but still smiled as a result.

Sakura opened one of the maps and was amazed at the sight. There was a rolling landscape drawn out complete with names, compass and a key. Each of the edges was marked out by a key feature; in the North high hills gave way to a great river, in the East a tall mountain range rose up, in the South another great river flowed along the edge of a forest and, in the West, open sea was in evidence. This was her kingdom. Sakura quickly found her home marked out as 'The Imperial Palace', which was about seven miles North-East of the capital, which in turn sat beside a long winding river.

Sakura took out the book next before she had a look at the other map. It seemed a standard explanatory work but there were lines that had names written over them.

Miss Kinomoto Sakura, The words read, Thank you for your patronage of the new Twin Bells Giantess Government Service. This book will help you work out how your nation works and what principles both you and your subjects are recommended to adhere to for best results. Every nation that acquires a giantess as their ruler will have many perks from this in terms of national security and stability of government. However you may find some under your rule who won't settle down and may attempt to drive you out of authority or worse; in these cases you are at liberty to punish them however you see fit. If you can't work out how far somewhere is in your kingdom just take the distance on the map and divide by fifty, don't worry if this doesn't take roads and rivers into account as most of these you can easily step over.

The nation over which you rule shall take on whatever name you choose to give it. The names of the various towns and villages within your lands are marked out on the map of your nation as provided but you are entitled to change these names at any time. Please do not expand your borders as those lands will either be under the rule of another giantess, have the potential to become so or may overstretch your distance of travel. Sakura paused and double-checked the map. It seemed that her home was almost slap-bang in the centre of this nation. The political authority of your mortal subjects will follow the setup they've been using before your arrival but you can change it and its overall structure at any time. Most countries selected for giantess-rule have sufficient resources to be self-sustaining but it's recommended that you seek trading partners as soon as you are comfortable with diplomacy.

If you wish to return to your hometown at any time, please step through the extra door provided and you'll return to our reception area. This continued for a while, detailing her authority to choose what system of currency her subjects could use, what systems of measurement they'd have and what title she could have; apparently 'Empress' was the default. Once she had finished the instructions she found that most of the book was a set of forms that she could fill out to constitutionalise her every decision in ruling this land.

1153111.content:
It started off as another normal day at the Constant Magick Academy, and the students were once again out on the the field to conduct another lesson in mana control. As usual, Akuto Sai and Junko Hattori were paired up for the exercise. Junko began charging a ball of magical energy between her hands and prepared to toss it to Akuto.

"Alright Sai, I'm gonna pass you the ball now... You had better not blow me up again!"

Akuto simply sighed and rubbed the back of his head.

"Hey, it's not my fault that I can't control my powers completely yet... I bet that you would have trouble keeping your power under control too if you were the demon king!"

"Oh please! I bet I could at least avoid turning a little ball of mana like this into a nuclear bomb!"

"If it were a nuclear bomb, then you would never have survived the blast..."

"Twice..."

"Okay Hattori, I get it... But isn't that the whole point of this lesson? To learn how to control mana properly?"

"Yeah, whatever... But if you start to lose control again, then could you please aim the ball somewhere else this time?!"

Akuto simply nodded and allowed Junko to toss the ball of magic energy to him. As usual, he caught the ball with ease; and as usual, his overwhelming mana began to make the ball go out of control. Seeing this, Junko quickly ducked for cover. Unfortunately for her, Akuto wasn't able to redirect the blast in time, and she ended up being hit by the ball of mana as it exploded violently on contact. However, unlike usual, the explosion was rather small this time and Junko was able to remain conscious. She immediately got to her feet again and angrily drew her katana. She swiftly swung it right under Akuto's chin, the cold steel mere inches from his neck.

"What did I just say to you! You were supposed to aim the ball away from me if you lost control again!"

Akuto nervously pushed the blade away from his neck.

"I tried to, but I just couldn't do it in time. Hey, at least the blast was a lot smaller this time... Maybe I'm getting a little bit better at controlling my powers."

The blue-haired maiden quickly sheathed her sword.

"Now that you mention it, I am still conscious this time... I guess I'll forgive you for it just this once-Ugh!"

Suddenly, Junko fell to her knees, clutching her head in pain. Akuto panicked and ran up next to her.

"Junko, are you okay?! What's wrong?!"

He reached out to place his hand on Junko's shoulder, but she quickly slapped it away.

"Akuto... Get away from me... NOW!"

Akuto was very worried now.

"What do you mean, Junko?"

"There's no time... I can feel something happening to my body... Please, just get to somewhere far away from me... Someplace safe..."

Akuto didn't know what was going on, but he understood that Junko was worried about his well-being. Giving her a quick nod, Akuto began to run in the opposite direction. By now, all of the other students and teachers had retreated as well, and were nervously watching their class rep from inside the building. What happened next frightened even Akuto himself: The young Junko Hattori was beginning to grow! Everyone watched in awe as the blue-haired girl began to increase in size before their very eyes. Junko was growing at an incredible speed. She quickly reached 10 feet tall, then 25, then 50, and then 100! It seemed for a moment as if she was going to keep growing forever, but her growth soon began to slow down. 125 feet, 135, 140, 145... When she stopped growing at last, Junko Hattori was standing at an unbelievable 150 feet tall.

Seeing his closest friend now towering over the entire school building itself, Akuto was visibly nervous. Yet, he knew Junko better than anyone else, and he knew that she would never hurt anyone. Slowly he walked up to her massive form and stared up at her. Junko knelt down and grinned at the small demon king before plucking him between her thumb and index finger. She then placed him in the palm of her hand and looked down on him with a mischievous smirk.

"Well, well, well... What do I have here? A naughty little demon king trying to get a quick peek up my skirt?"

Akuto blushed at this comment.

"Of course not, Junko! I was just worried about you!"

"Awww, that's sweet... But don't worry, I think I really like this new size!"

"W-what does that mean?"

"It means that I'm gonna be the new queen of this academy from now on!"

"WHAT?! But Junko-"

Akuto was cut off by Junko placing her finger over his mouth to silence him.

"Don't worry little Akuto, I'm not going to hurt you... _______________."

1153312.content:
The gigantic regent of Germany stretched her arms into the air, focusing, then punching. She'd been jogging some time before, looking over her citizens; each gave a bow as she came across, as directed. They always had to be in top condition, on guard in case of an invasion- or, in case Prussia tried to become an independent nation again, and went around crushing random buildings. Germany was determined to set an example to her people, and thus, set up a strict exercise routine. Besides, a ruler had to keep appearances- a shapely ruler would be both intimidating to other women, and able to gain diplomatic advantages.

Her jacket wrapped across her waist, she'd worked up a bit of a sweat, and was about to consider taking a 7-second beer break. When, in an instant, a familiar, irritating screech sounded out across the German land.

"Germany! Hey, GERMANY!"

The pounding of booted feet crashed through the quiet countryside. The land of great poets and thinkers, ruined by this woman's careless treading... From afar, Germany couldn't help but sigh, rubbing the bridge of her nose. Italy, her southern neighbor. With her casual smile, messy hair, and relaxed slouch, it was hard to believe she could be the queen of anything- much less the granddaughter of Rome, the great conqueror. Germany wondered: was there a single nation in Europe who hadn't occupied Italy at one time or another? Even that sissy France had taken her over once.

Buildings that her people had worked so hard to build, turned to ashes... As the queens were finally close enough, she called out again. "Ciao, salve, buongiorno, Germany! I decided to come over for a visit!"

Crossing her arms, the blonde queen stared directly at her. "Italy... You're standing on the marketplace, you dummkopf."

Shocked, Italy looked down at the debris by her boots. She took a step back, panicking, struggling to apologize to the people- before tripping over a building behind her. Her backside made a mighty rumbling as it hit the ground, destroying the homes of dozens.

Silently, Germany marched over to reach for her. If it wasn't one thing with this girl, it was another... Yet, there was some odd charm about her. As she propped the visiting queen up, dusting her off, she stared directly at her.

"What is it, Italy?"

"Ahahaha, it's a funny story- I'm in a biiiit of a financial crisis. It's nothing big, but I thought, hey, maybe I'd take this as an opportunity to have some fun with my best sis, and get some trades going while I'm at it!"

To Germany's shock, she reached into her clothes- and pulled out a bunch of noblemen, shivering, dazed from the journey. Some had even traveled in her boots.

"I even brought a whole bunch of friends! So, whaddya say, huh, Germany? We can have siestas together, eat pasta- it'll be a party!"

13421.content:
Wanda was once again caught indulging the stupidity of Cosmo and Timmy. Granted their shenanigans weren't nearly as inexcusable as Timmy's Parents were. She rather despised how wrongfully they mistreated Timmy. Not to mention she did hold a grudge against them - in the past, Timmy requested that she and Cosmo pose as new friends for them...and needless to say, their rude and otherwise life-threatening behavior towards the two of them was...undesirable. She remembered combing through Da Rule Book to see if there was a Rule against Eliminating the God-Child's parents...She begrudgingly found one.

But she didn't deny that she cared for Timmy - he gave her the greatest gift anyone could ever get her. He wished for her and Cosmo to have a Fairy-Baby - Poof. It was a remarkable wish that Wanda remembered fondly as one of her favorites that Timmy ever made. Unfortunately, such a wish would never be made again, as immediately after, Jorgen made wishing for a Fairy Baby to be Against Da Rules...She often wondered how he was able to do that.
But undoubtedly she loved Timmy - and if the way she and Cosmo were able to take care of Poof was any indication, than they would certainly make better guardians for Timmy. If only the parents weren't in the way of everything.

"Hey Wanda?" Wanda suddenly snapped out of her thinking when Timmy called to her. She saw that he and Cosmo had stopped playing their game. "What time is it?" Timmy asked her.

Wanda lightly bounced Poof in her arms while she pulled out her wand. With a wave, she made a clock magically appear. "It's 11 o'clock, Sport," she answered using her pet-name for Timmy.

"Whoa, that was quite a work-out Timmy," Cosmo said.

"I'm pleased that you guys are actually playing outside instead of inside playing Videogames," Wanda commented.

"Yeah," Timmy said with a frown. His stomach betrayed a growl. "I'm pretty hungry. But it's past 10:30 and I can't make any breakfast wishes."

"Aw, sorry Timmy but those are the Rules," Wanda said. "How about a nice Sandwich?"

"YES PLEASE!" Cosmo suddenly said bouncing over Timmy's head. He raised his own wand and pooffed himself up a large hero sandwich and proceeded to eat it all in one bite.

"Wanda - what is it with Da Rules anyway?" Timmy asked. "I understand that some are meant to protect the world from stupid wishes. But why have something as frivolous as 'No Breakfast Wishes before 10:30 AM?"

"Well I don't make Da Rules, Sport; I just have to follow them," Wanda said.

"Well...Who does make Da Rules?" Timmy asked.

Cosmo burped after finishing his sandwich, making Poof laugh. "That would be Jorgen, Timmy. He makes all the Rules AND Enforces them."

"Huh...I get that Jorgen is 'The Most Powerful Fairy in the Universe' but I just don't get how he can just write Da Rules. If he could, then he would potentially be able to do anything he wants. Sometimes it seems like Da Rules keep him in check just as much as any other fairy. I don't buy it. Maybe there's something else that determines what goes into Da Rules; something that's even stronger than Jorgen."

"Heh - Maybe it's Wanda's cooking; few things are more powerful than that!" Cosmo said.

Wanda sneered at Cosmo for that comment at her expense. But then she noticed that Timmy actually looked like he was thinking something over. Whenever Timmy started getting curious about something like this, it meant that things would soon be headed for trouble.

"Hey - can we take a field trip to Fairy World to find out where Da Rules come from?" Timmy asked.

"Aw Sport - I was planning to take Poof for a walk in the Park," Wanda whined, trying to get out of it.

"I Wish we were in Fairy World!" Timmy said excitedly with a smile.

Wanda sighed and raised her wand. She had a feeling that this was going to lead to trouble.

"Uh...Well yes," Jorgen began to say knowing that he'd been caught. "I was far more strict back then. But I think I've more than mellowed out since I married the Tooth Fairy."

"Speaking of which - how Is Mrs. Von Strangle now a days?" Timmy asked. "I think I have some information regarding your previous God-Children that she'd be VERY interested in." Timmy suddenly revealed photographs of Jorgen with a small and timid child who appeared with him at the Fairy-Awards. The child looked like he was missing a few teeth.

"DYAAAAAH! HOW DID YOU GET THOSE TURNER! HAND THEM OVER, NOW!!!" Jorgen shouted, now in near panic at the vulnerable position that Timmy had caught him in.

1342111.content:
Jorgen took his Da Rule Book and brought it over to a portrait of himself that he kept on the wall at the far-side of his bunker. He moved it on its hinges to reveal a rectangle shaped hole behind it. He brought up his hand and put the book inside. Once inside, the magic from the book flowed into the wall. Suddenly creases on the concrete wall were revealed and the large slab suddenly slid open revealing a staircase behind it.

Jorgen tapped his wand on the ground again, and the star began to glow red. He turned toward the group behind him and said, "Wands on; Now."

Cosmo and Wanda lit up their wands in the similar fashion as Jorgen as he began to lead them down the stairs. The staircase was long and winding and seemed to lead into some kind of dark underground cavern. Jorgen began to explain what all of this meant.

"Eons ago, before the Time of the Darkness, the Elder Fairies knew to guard - above all other things - the most sacred artifact from the Dawn of Fairy History; The Sacred Text of Da Rule Maker..."

"Da Rule Maker?" Timmy asked behind him.

"It is said that at the Dawn of Time, there was a Guardian of All Creation who created Fairy World and all of the Fairies in it, as a means of watching over Mankind. He is the one who gave us all our Magical Powers. But he understood, that without a way to properly Check and Balance the Fairies Magic, that some fairies would use it irresponsibly and use it to conquer all of the Universe. So he passed down a Sacred Document with a series of Rules to prevent Fairies from using their magic improperly so that Fairies would learn to use their Magic Responsibly. And from that moment on, he was known as Da Rule Maker..."

"And he's the one where all of Da Rules come from?" Timmy asked.

"Yes and No," Jorgen answered as they continued down the steps. "You see - he created the first sacred doctrine of Magical Law and set it upon the Fairies, basically making the foundations for Fairy Law; why we take care of Godchildren, or why we cannot use magic to kill. But after leaving the first generation of Fairies the sacred document, he vanished. They say he now exists beyond Time itself. And when he did leave, the Elder Fairies were put in charge of guarding the text. When the Darkness and the Eliminators first invaded, the Elder Fairies had to relinquish the task to another. And ever since, the Von Strangle family have held the responsibility....Here."

The group finally came to the bottom of the staircase. The chamber was dark until suddenly a large light in the center came on. It revealed that the ground they stood on was a circle with a large pit in the center. And levitating in the pit was the largest copy of Da Rule Book they had ever laid eyes on. It was large enough that they could stand upon the cover.

"This is the original copy of Da Rules - the Sacred Document that Da Rule Maker passed down to our people. The Original Book from which all copies come - to be held by each individual fairy in Fairy World," Jorgen said.

"Wow," Timmy said slowly stepping toward the edge to the pit to get a closer look at the large purple book. "So wait...if this is the original volume of Da Rules, then how is it that you can add rules to it - like the "No Wishing for Christmas Everyday" or "No Wishing for Fairy Babies?"

"Ah - that is the Most important part. You see, when Da Rule Maker gave us the Sacred Text, he left us with a way to Amend and Add to Da Rules..." Jorgen said. Suddenly he looked up above the book, prompting the group to do the same. Up above was were two magically sealed glass cylinders, inside the smaller of which was a beautiful artifact. Hovering in the center was a Wand with a long red handle, ending in a golden star. Beneath the star was a kind of hilt made of blue wings. It was a wand like no other.
"Da Rule Maker's Wand," Jorgen continued. "The only tool in Existence that can edit the pages of Da Rules. Watch..."

Jorgen waved his wand. Suddenly, the inner most glass cylinder began to slide downward and the outer most cylinder began to rise, leaving the wand hovering in air. Jorgen reached up his hand and took the wand. It appeared so tiny in comparison to his enormous hands. He waved the wand and the large Rule Book opened up. It's pages began to roll back until the page with the final rule added to it.

"Cosmo, Wanda - take out your copy of Da Rules," Jorgen ordered. The two fairies did as he said - their copy appearing before them open to that page. Jorgan began to slowly pass Da Rule Keeper's Wand over the blank page. And suddenly, words marked in dark ink began to print themselves across the blank space remaining on the page.

Let it be Decreed that Blackmail of a Fairy by a Godchild is a Crime punishable by the Loss and/or Dismissal of a Fairy Godparent(s).

In Cosmo and Wanda's copy, they viewed that the words suddenly appeared, letter by letter in their book too. Timmy read the entire thing.
"Oh c'mon Jorgen!" Timmy shouted.

"HA-HA! You tempted me to use Da Rules for my own gain Turner. Perhaps you should've known better. You see - NO one controls Jorgen Von Strangle. Now hand over those photographs, or loose your fairies."

"Pfft - Fine Jorgen," Timmy said handing over his incriminating photographs. "I'll destroy the copies I have when I get back home."

"Good - now all is as it should be," Jorgen said taking the photos and burning them with the light from his own wand. He raised his hand giving Da Rule Maker's Wand a push back up toward the case. The cylinders closed shut around it. "Now - I hope you all are satisfied, and now it is time to go."

"Well - thanks for showing us this place Jorgen; it actually was kind of fun," Timmy said turning toward the staircase.

"I know this goes without saying, Turner; but NO one can know about this. If anyone knew the location of Da Rule Maker's Wand and the Original Text, then the fate of the whole universe would be in Grave Danger," Jorgen said.

"Hey - I've kept a lid on my secret of having fairies for more than Fifty years, I'm sure I can keep this hidden," Timmy said walking away.

"Hey-Hey-Hey!" Jorgen began snapping. "You're lucky you still have your fairies after that little Secret-Wish Stunt, Turner."

Cosmo and Poof flew above Timmy as he proceeded up the staircase. Jorgen was about to follow, however, Wanda stayed behind, thinking about some things. She suddenly beckoned to Jorgen.

"Jorgen...you sure have joked about Timmy loosing us a lot today," Wanda said. "You don't...really want him to be without Fairies, do you?"

"Wanda...he is responsible for more amendments to Da Rules than any Godchild in the History of Fairy World," Jorgen said. "The day he is finally ready to no longer have fairies, will mean less headaches for me."

"But what about all the good Timmy has done? Sure he has caused a lot of trouble, but he's saved Earth AND Fairy World countless times. He's the Chosen One who defeated the Darkness and the Eliminators."

"Hmm - you have a point," he said.

"Also...Jorgen. It's...commonplace to know that when a child looses their Fairy Godparents," Wanda began. "Then...all of the magic that they've influenced...all of the things they've done...all the things they've wished for...They're undone and the memory of them is erased as if it never was. Would that mean that...Lighting the Darkness would never happen? Or that...Poof...would disappear?"

"Hmm," Jorgen began to think. "Well...there would be a few minor setbacks. But yes. Everything that Turner has ever wished for or accomplished will be erased from existence. The only thing that will remain in tact are Da Rules that he has caused."

Wanda was absolutely taken aback by this. Jorgen basically told her that should Timmy ever loose her or Cosmo...then Poof would vanish from existence. She would not only loose her godchild but her own baby too! She looked forward and saw Timmy now carrying Poof up the stairs, playing with his nose. Poof absolutely adored Timmy, and Timmy loved Poof like a true brother. She absolutely couldn't let either of them go now...Regardless of what Da Rules might say.

...And that's when the realization struck her. The entire text for the Unbreakable Rules laid behind her. And the Wand for editing said document...above her. She slowly looked up at the display case holding Da Rule Maker's Wand. The case was sealed...undoubtedly unable to be opened by none other than Jorgen's Wand. And said wand...was right in front of her, just feet from her.

Why did her father make her wear it? It was a rare occasion when she was allowed to remove it, only to have it replaced with another. The entry in her Diary consisted of the Hylian customs. Ever since it was established, a man has always served as primary monarch, where as queens hardly had any power, and served only as figureheads. Therefore, Zelda learned that her father did not plan to pass the throne onto her. She wouldn't be allowed to rule when her time came. Instead - she was lavished and surrounded by jewels, and servants, and luxurious comforts, to passify her into compliance. She wasn't her father's heir...She was just his jewel. He told her a fantastic story - that while it was bewildering, something deep inside her knew it was true. Link traveled into the future where Ganondorf had succeeded in stealing the Triforce of Power and then took over Hyrule and ushered in Seven Years of Darkness. Luckily, Link and Zelda teamed up together and took Hyrule back from the Evil King, and cast him into the pit.

But then, as a reward for all Link had done, Zelda sent him back in Time using the very same Ocarina so that Link could regain his childhood, and prevent the awful future from happening. She thought it over - and realized that sending him back in time was the worst strategy she could've employed. It basically negated everything that Link had worked so hard for. What was the point of sending him back in Time, when her plans as a child inadvertently allowed Hyrule's downfall? If it wasn't for Link retaining his memory, it was almost certain that history would play out and nothing would change.

But what she didn't like most of all was the fact that she treated Hyrule like a Do-Over. Why wouldn't she let Link stay in the future with her? Together, they could've rebuilt Hyrule and had a new beginning - lead Hyrule into a better future. Sending him back and time made Zelda think that her future counterpart was a coward and that she was too afraid of the responsibilities of ruling. So she erased it all from happening. Sure it seemed like a good idea to spare the people of Hyrule of a rather grim Dictatorship. But there was however one major flaw in the plan; Ganondorf.

All of Zelda's suspicions about the man were true. But even if Link prevented him from ever getting the Triforce of Power, he was still a Wizard. But going back into the past, where he remained free. The only one who could prevent the future was Link. He told Zelda the story, but still, they were only children. She had told her father her fears of Ganondorf before. And as expected, he didn't believe her. So when she and Link went before him, not only did he not believe her, but he was furious that a peasant boy was in his castle. He ordered Link thrown out of the castle or into the dungeon. So Ganondorf continued to walk free. But since Zelda had given the Ocarina of Time to Link, he could never open the door of time. He never laid siege to the castle.

15523221.content:
"Jess, I'm going out. Want anything from the store?"

"No thanks. Got a few new books, think I'm going to be tied down studying for a while," Jessica said, not looking up from a large slab of leather and paper set in front of her. The book was a transcription of a much older volume, and each page was split between the original language and a rough English translation. It covered most of the small desk it lay on, and under the light from the room's window small discoloration could be seen on its pages. Tori really disliked books like this, and unfortunately they came home all too often. Her own interest in chemistry did not require odd, foreboding tomes tha screamed occult knowledge. Jessica's own history education meant she had to do much more work with primary sources. And so, piles of cursed books living in their tiny apartment. She could not wait to find a new place. The quiet girl she'd roomed with as a freshman was still quiet, but had become downright scary. Tori eyed her hunched shoulders and face almost pressing against the pages.

"You're staring." Jessica said. Her head had turned slightly, the corner of one eye visible behind a lock of dark hair. "Weren't you going?"

"Yeah, right. Sorry. And nothing for you? I'll get a coffee or something, especially if you're going to be up late," Tori returned, hastily pulling the door open.

"Nothing." Tori knew Jessica talked like this all the time, and didn't mean to be rude or creepy. It still got to her though. Quietly she shut the door on her roommate.

Focused on the book, Jessica smiled. She knew how scared she made her friend. At first, this made her a little upset and tried to be more friendly with Tori. This only seemed to worsen things, and soon she found herself playing up the role of spooky flatmate. However intimidated she felt by the six foot tall, stunningly gorgeous genius she lived with, Tori had become far more scared of her. Eventually, Jessica came to see some justice in this. At least it left her plenty of time for work.

Her current book was a transcription of an older Mesopotamian text. The translation had been poor to begin with, and going through several different "refinements" had not improved it. What had sold itself as a manifest of trade within the city of Ur seemed to be more focused on the ritual significance of the products coming in to the city. Jessica was impressed by the amount of herbs burned, but not at all interested by the details. But before she lost all hope in the book, a short translator's note about the ritual in question grabbed her attention. The ceremony was for the appointment of the city-state's new ruler, a monarch who would rule in the name of the gods and share in their power. Her left hand, the one not holding down the page, fidgeted. Whenever things like this came up, she got excited. A lifelong fascination with horror movies and forbidden knowledge drove her to the more bizarre ancient rituals. And an ancient ritual to give someone godlike powers? Jessica grinned.

She needed more information on the process in question, not just an ingredients list. Just in case, she copied down all the materials used. She did get bored every now and again, and liked to have ways to blow of steam. Besides, who hadn't tried to summon demons or talk with the dead? The surprisingly small amount of materials copied down, she walked to her room and grabbed a hoodie from her bed. Throwing it over her T-shirt, she went back to her desk to pick up her wallet and keys. Yes, she had Internet, but it wasn't the same reading about knowledge of the elders online. She much preferred to hold the aging paper in her hands, rather than displayed on a screen. Jessica walked to the apartment's entrance just as the door swung open.

Tori saw Jessica just standing inside the doorway and jumped back with a yelp. Was it her imagination or did she smirk for a second?

"Sorry, startled me there," Tori said, laughing nervously. "You look sick, are you feeling alright?"

"I'm fine. Been reading a while. I need another book, so I'm going to the library," Jessica said. She looked up at Tori, who stared back uncomfortably. "I was just heading out. Not waiting to startle you." Jessica tried to clarify, smiling slightly. Tori smiled tightly in reply.

"No worries. You want me to go with? It's gonna be dark soon"

"I'll be fine. I put the last person who tried something in the river," Jessica said. She walked past Tori, who looked unsure about whether Jessica had just tried to make a joke, and outside.

'When did it get dark?' She wondered. Her reading had begun at 10 AM, as it usually did. 'When did it turn to spring?' Jessica asked, even more incredulously. Quickly pulling her hoodie off, she grabbed a bus and went down to the library.

Tori was just getting dressed for bed when Jessica got home. At least, she hoped it was her roommate. The door slammed and a small figure padded into her room, so Tori assumed it was her. Jessica usually didn't start conversations and she was tired. Yawning, Tori turned her back and walked towards her bed.

"Tori." Tori turned and almost screamed when she saw Jessica right behind her. The poor girl looked exhausted, but at the same time had a frenzied light in her eye.

"Hey, Jess. What's up?" Tori said. Jessica held forth a small book. It looked new.

"Want to try something cool?" Jessica said. Tori almost dropped her lower jaw in awe. Never, had she heard Jessica describe something as "cool". And she had NEVER been invited to do something with this girl. After the initial shock, she got just a little suspicious.

"What is it?" Tori asked.

"Get the powers of ancient gods." Tori eyed her warily. Jessica was not one to make jokes. Her invitation and new vocabulary were out of character, but a joke was beyond belief. She didn't know if she was religious or not, but she also had not mentioned gods before.

"Are you...serious?"

"If you don't want to that's fine. I'll be up for a while though. Did you get coffee?"

"No, sorry, thought you didn't want any." Tori paused. Jessica looked slightly disappointed, which was another first. After a moment, the shorter girl turned to walk away. "Wait a minute," Tori grinned down, "Let's give it a try!"

Then she was moving towards the square, although her vision was fading. Jessica gave one more heave, left hand still anchored to the book, and brought Tori's torso into the square. Her hand slapped against the rough papyrus of the book. Tori could see clearly now, but her thoughts were still swimming through concrete. It looked like they were surrounded on all sides by legions of dark figures clutching staffs. They chanted in a vaguely eastern language, and Jessica sounded like she was trying to answer them.

"I need to see a doctor Jess, I think someone drugged me."

Tori was lying on the floor of their "main" room, the medium-sized room connecting their small bedrooms. Everything was sore, her head was pounding, and the light coming through the windows sent an ice pick into her brain. She squeezed her eyes shut and tried to ignore the discomfort. A minute or so passed, and her eyes felt like they might stay in her head of she opened her eyelids. A fraction of an inch at a time, Tori lifted them. The daylight was painful, but bearable. She took quick stock of her surroundings.

The house was a mess. Books scattered the floor, their TV lay facedown surrounded by a fine dusting of broken glass. The wooden floorboards had horrific stains, the fan was in pieces, and the couch was shredded. Jessica's room, from what she could see, looked like someone had set off a bomb. Jessica herself was...hunched over Tori's legs muttering incoherently. Tori tried to say something, but her mouth was gummy and her throat sore. The hoarse rasp broke her roommate'so trance, though, and she shuffled over to Tori's head. She looked closely into her eyes and placed a cool palm against Tori's forehead.

"How do you feel?" Jessica asked. It sounded like she was speaking through water. Tori took a moment to process before responding.

"Like I've been boxing with Mohammed Ali," Tori said. Every word hurt. She tried to raise herself up but Jessica's hands were suddenly on her chest, forcing her back to the floor. Tori fought weakly. Jessica looked at he friend with a scary intensity, and Tori struggled harder.

"You need to stay still. I got most of you through safely, but they took you legs." Tori looked along her body at her pink feet. She wiggled each toe in sequence, from left to right.

"Jess, my toes are fine. What are you talking about?" The other girl seemed frustrated.

"When you didn't stay in the square I couldn't do what I needed to. Also, you threw my damn drink away so I was trying to make do with what I had available."

"My feet are fine, look!" Tori said, still not seeing what Jessica's problem was. This kind of thing was why she was moving out. "Our apartment though..."

"It's fine, I don't need anything here."

"Jess, all my shit's here. This is everything I fucking own, and it's trashed. What the hell happened?" Tori was slowly dissolving the fog in her mind. She remembered drinking something Jessica handed her, and falling down.

"You drugged me!" Tori tried again to stand up. This time Jessica sat back on her legs and watched.

"You gave me that drink, and then I must have passed out. Jessica, what did you do to me? I'm calling the fucking police, and I'm getting out of this place!" Tori was sitting up, getting angrier as she got closer to upright. She tried to tuck a leg beneath her and stand, but her legs were unresponsive. They twitched a bit, but neither moved very far.

"They need a few more minutes for the nerves to attach," Jessica said, leaning forward and gently touching Tori's left leg. For the first time she saw the torn and singed remains of her underwear, just managing to cover her.

"You raped me," she said softly, taking it in. Louder, she repeated it. Finally she yelled it at the top of her lungs and lunged for the woman gently kneading her thighs. She almost reached, but without any help from he lower half she flopped impotently against the floor. Quietly, Tori cried to herself. Jessica continued working her way down her left leg, and repeated the process on the right. After ten minutes, she stood up.

"You can walk now." Jessica said. Tori looked up at the girl, tears blurring her vision.

"How could you?" Tori asked, voice flat. Jessica stared down, her face inscrutable. Tori couldn't take it, and looked down at herself. Her pajama top was mostly fine, fraying a little below the navel. Her hands looked slightly burned, but otherwise okay. The left arm was fine, but the right arm had a bizarre black pattern woven on it, like the intricate fibers of a reed basket.

"When did I get this tattoo?" Tori asked. Jessica held her right arm out, rolling back the sleeve of an oversized hoodie. An identical pattern was inscribed in her flesh.

"We're married." She stated. And walked off into her room, out of which smoke was now wafting.

"What," Tori began. "No, we are not, Jessica. We are roommates. I am moving out. And you are going to jail for assaulting-"

Jessica strode out of the room carrying a large book and threw it on the ground besides Tori. A recollection of the previous night came flooding back all at once. The ghosts, the hurricane, Jessica knelt over the book.

"Oh," she said, softly.

"It was the only way they would let the both of us go. This was not supposed to be a ritual for two people." Jessica stood over her, hands sunk into the hoodie's pickets.

Jessica left at sun-up and was still wandering when the sun went down. She muttered to herself as she walked around downtown. People who looked at the haggard college girl got a vicious stare for their trouble. Jessica visited the library, but couldn't stand the people whispering. No matter where she read, no matter how deep in the stacks she lurked, she was chased by these inane conversations. There was no peace. Same thing at any museum or coffee shop. She fidgeted anxiously and chewed her lip constantly. Eventually she resorted to wandering the cavernous alleys between skyscrapers. It was still noisy, but the sounds of generators, elevators, and A/C units were better than other people. For hours, she walked. Jessica wanted to think about the infinite power she controlled, but the second her mind drifted that way her tattoo began to burn. And so she simmered, the memory of what she had committed to always fresh in her mind.

Jessica almost started for home at about dusk, but the thought of Tori curled on the floor kept her out. On the one hand, she had saved her...wife...from painful spiritual torment for eternity. On the other hand, they were now bound by a bond not even her power could dissolve without damning the both of them. It was an uneasy truce, the one concession the gods she had robbed had been able to force on her. Jessica sighed. It was a shame both she and Tori were straight.

"Hey, gotta light?" Someone asked from a doorway. Jessica snapped back to reality. The guy, taller and rounder than her and dressed like a professional, leaned against a recessed door to an office block.

"Sure," she replied, stepping to the side and pulling out her lighter. He held out a cigarette and she flicked the wheel. She heard a soft parting of air behind her and then felt a sudden red blossom of pain on her neck. She dropped like ton of cod onto a trawler.

"Jesus, I think you broke her neck Jim."

"Just enough to put her out for a bit. She'll be up in a minute."

"Your turn to go first, right?"

"Damn right son." Both laugh. Jessica heard a metallic scrape, belt buckle coming undone. She pulled her arm under her chest and pushed herself up.

"Nevermind Jimmy, looks like she's still kicking. Been skipping workout recently?"

"Mick, that would've put a bull out cold. Want me to try again?" Metal bat against fleshy palm.

"Nah, I like a little bit of a fight. Not too much though." A zipper went down. Jessica was scared. Her arms wobbled and her vision swam. Breathing heavily, she let her head ring for a second. When it slowed just a bit she lunged to her feet. Unsteadily, she looked around. Two men were in front of her, behind her was a door. Her eyes wouldn't focus and her stomach was trying to crawl out of her mouth. But she was less scared now, by all rules that hit should have killed her. Now, she was angry.

"Hey, take one more hit. She's givin me the crazy eye," Mick said. Jim stepped forward, hefting the bat. He swung straight for the side of Jessica's head.

The bat smacked against her hand, stopping dead. Jim stared, wide-eyed. Jessica closed her fingers around it, and felt him try to jerk it away. She smiled, and he let go of the bat to back away. She squeezed and the aluminum flattened easily. Jesica let it drop, and stepped towards her attackers.

"What the fuc-" Mick stammered out, but then Jessica was on top of him. She breezed past him, stepping sideway on his knee as she passed. He screamed like a banshee, and toppled sideways. Jim was quicker, and swung for the tiny girl. She saw the fist coming, and easily got inside his reach. Almost before she could react his other hand was there, and she had to swat it away or take a nasty knock. Jim's other hand had time to pull back and strike again, but this time Jessica grabbed just behind his wrist and pulled him forward. His eyes were wide and mouth open a little wider than usual as she stared up into them. Then her right hand pressed against his neck and they focused on that. She tightened her grip just a little, trying not to crush his throat like the bat. Regardless, he started to turn a deep shade of red and fell to his knees. Jessica's breath caught in her throat and her fingers dug in a little deeper. Rivulets of blood dripped from her fingertips and Jim's mouth worked like a beached fish. She let go of his other hand, clutching his neck with both hands now. She could feel the blood flowing through his aorta beneath her fingertips. His hands smacked at hers and tried to pry them off, but Jessica had no problem holding on. He was purple now, and gasping much less. Her hands squeezed tighter, her breathing faster now. Her stomach fluttered in time with the muscles in his neck. Something crunched but she still held on. Her fingers were drenched in blood and she could hear his desperate gagging like jet engines in her ears. Finally, with a yell, she pressed down as hard as she could. With a spray of blood, Jessica's hands easily tore through muscle, tissue, and spine. Jim's head fell off his body and she laughed.

Jessica looked at her hands. Stained with blood and gore, with bits of bone fragment stuck on for good measure. Intoxicated, she looked from her bloody digits to the lifeless body in front of her. And then someone behind her moaned. Mick! Jessica whirled around to find her other attacker. He was lying in the doorway, staring at her. Slowly, her hands still held in front of her, she walked over to him. He tried to back farther into the corner, murmuring something.

"My hands," Jessica said, smiling wildly. She pressed their backs against his face, and he wriggled like a worm on a hook. Slowly, she flipped them over until her fingers were wrapped in fistfuls of his short, dark hair. He tried to say something, but Jessica wasn't listening. She lifted him up by the roots of his hair, making him yell. Soundlessly, she slammed his skull against the door. He coughed once and died. But she didn't stop for a while. Finally, the pain in her arm made her drop the mess of a man and cry out. She grabbed the mark, smearing her arm with the mess she'd made. Grimacing in pain, she made her way back to her apartment. Someone might have seen her, but no one stopped her. Well past midnight, she opened the door to the apartment. Everything was dark, but she could hear Tori moving somewhere inside.

"Victoria. I'm home."

155232211222.content:
"They're dead then?"

"Yes."

"You killed them."

"Yes."

"Did you like it?"

Jessica stood perfectly still. She looked at herself, her hoodie flecked with bits of dried blood. Her hands had scalp, hair, and various gristle. She rotated them, taking it all in. Her cheek felt just a little bit colder and her eye stung. Her world went blurry and her body shook slightly. A tear dripped off her chin and splashed on her hand. Tori stepped out of her room, dressed in jeans and a T-shirt. Some logo was stamped on the front, but Jessica couldn't see well enough to make it out. A choked, painful sound forced its way out of her throat. A soft sob followed it out and Jessica was crying. Tori stood and watched for a moment. Abruptly, she walked to Jessica in three strides and enveloped her in a hug. The smaller girl collapsed, but Tori gently lowered her to the floor. Her chest heaved, but the sobbing was silent now. Her wet face glistened in the moonlight, and snot ran from her nose. Carefully, Tori took Jessica in her arms and walked to the bathroom. The room was cramped, but the two of them could just fit together. Once again placing her roommate on the floor Tori turned on the shower.

"Up," Tori said, turning back to Jessica. With her hands under her arms, she lifted Jessica to her feet like a toddler. She stayed upright, swaying only a little bit. Gently, Tori pulled the hoodie over her head. Tossing it back into the main room she lifted off the shirt, also stained with blood. Finally, trying not to think that this was her spouse, she unclasped Jessica's bra. Off came the pants and underwear, and all that was left was Jessica. In a daze, she walked under the steaming water and sat down heavily on the tile. Tori ran a washcloth under the shower head, then rubbed soap on it. Gently, she dabbed at the stains and pulled strands of hair from her friend's fingers. The shower ran red as she worked her way down Jessica's arms and washed the rest of her. When she finally washed the last clumps of gore from Jessica's raven hair, Tori stood up. Jessica looked up at her, but made no motion to stand. After a moment she looked back down, and Tori stepped out. She managed to find a fresh set of clothes in the wreckage of Jessica's room, and placed them in the bathroom.

Tori sat on the couch for an hour while the water ran in the bathroom. She was working her way through some trashy novel she'd picked up weeks ago, but entirely unable to concentrate. When the water finally cut off, she stopped worrying that Jessica had drowned or something. Minutes later, Jessica emerged in a cloud of steam, wearing the pajamas Tori had brought her. Her eyes were swollen and red, but she looked much better than the shriveled child that had come home. Jessica stared into Tori for a moment, then shuffled off to her room. Tori checked in on her twenty minutes later. She was asleep, snoring softly. Satisfied, Tori went back to her room and lay down on her bed. It was a long time before she went to sleep.
